result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven P Arrington was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Steven P Arrington is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Steven P Arrington was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven P Arrington

defendant.name: Arrington, Steven P
defendant.address: 9715 S Rustic Pl, Oak Creek, WI 53154

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
1:39 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Mike Sias.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1, with no domestic enhancer with a fine and costs and count 2 will be dismissed.  State concurs.  Atty Sias concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1, striking the domestic enhancer.  Court orders count 2 be dismissed outright.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Statement by Atty Sias.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to: 

-$100 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 1:47 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

2:34 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Michael Sias.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Sias - have provided additional information to the DA and requests another court date.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on November 29, 2016 at 1:30 p.m. 

Court adjourned at 2:35 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 25, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

11:55 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Michael Sias.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Sias - will be getting information to the DA's office.  Court sets for Plea & Sentencing on October 25, 2016 at 2:30 p.m. 

Court adjourned at 11:56 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 27, 2016 at 11:30 am.

11:03 a.m. Defendant present in court with Atty Michael Sias.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Sias - met with the DA and requests a plea & sentencing date.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on September 27, 2016 at 11:30 a.m.  

Court adjourned at 11:03 a.m.
Status hearing on August 2, 2016 at 11:00 am.

8:48 a.m. Defendant present in court with Atty Michaell Sias.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Sias confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Atty Sias enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant. Court notes bond has been set. Court will set for Status Hearing on August 2 at 11:00 a.m..

Court adjourned at 8:50 a.m.

Defendant is to have no violent contact with Amber A.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

Defendant is to have no violent contact with Amber A.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Defendant appeared by video conference from the Green Lake County Jail.

2:23 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video and without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  DA Christenson makes bond recommendation.  Court orders $500 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to have no violent contact with Amber A.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant to appear for Initial Appearance on July 5, 2016 at 8:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 2:25 p.m.
